vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Potential SQL injection. Use parameterized queries instead of string formatting.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet: db.execute("UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance + ? WHERE id = ?", (amount, to_account))

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: Critical function "delete" has no authentication. Add @login_required or similar decorator.

vulnerabilities.title: Unrestricted File Upload
vulnerabilities.description: File upload without type validation. Restrict file types to whitelist only.

vulnerabilities.title: Insufficient Random Values
vulnerabilities.description: Use random.choice()/randint() for cryptographic operations. Use secrets module instead.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive data stored without encryption. Encrypt at rest and in transit.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive data stored without encryption. Encrypt at rest and in transit.

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection in Transfer Money Route
vulnerabilities.description: SQL Injection in Transfer Money Route
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# Business Logic Vulnerabilities (hard to detect with patterns)

@app.route('/transfer', methods=['POST'])

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection in Transfer Money Route
vulnerabilities.description: Command Injection in Transfer Money Route
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
from_account = request.form.get('from')
    to_account = request.form.get('to')
    amount = request.form.get('amount')

vulnerabilities.title: XSS in Transfer Money Route
vulnerabilities.description: XSS in Transfer Money Route
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# This is a classic IDOR (CWE-639)
    db.execute("UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - ? WHERE id = ?", (amount, from_account))
    db.execute("UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance + ? WHERE id = ?", (amount, to_account))

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow in Price Calculation
vulnerabilities.description:
In the `checkout` function, there is no overflow check on the multiplication of `quantity` and `price`. This can lead to an integer overflow if the user sets `quantity` to a very large number (e.g., \(2^{31}\)), resulting in a negative total. If the total exceeds zero, the customer will be charged, which could be exploited for financial gain.

### Reporting Format:
